text: Udonis Haslem and Dwyane Wade shared a moment last night while looking up at their jerseys in the raftersâ¤ï¸ What a moment for the Heat legends ğŸ™Œ (via @MiamiHEAT) pic.twitter.com/Puu1KauNIK Clutch Points: Rumor Hype Rumor visits per day for the last week Views per day January 20, 2024 | 11:02 am EST Update Blazers sign Taze Moore to 10-day contract Adrian Wojnarowski: The Portland Trail Blazers are signing G Taze Moore of the G Leagueâ€™s Rip City Remix on a 10-day contract,sources tell ESPN. Moore played his college basketball for Kelvin Sampson at Houston. Jorge Sierra: Kevin Durant passed Hassan Whiteside in blocks and Dominique Wilkins in rebounds last night. Just so you know. Michael Scotto: Cam Thomas: â€œI feel like the goal post always moves for me. When people now score all these points, itâ€™s all praise. But when I used to do it, itâ€™s always a knock.He canâ€™t play defense. He doesnâ€™t pass. But when I see other people doing the same thing, itâ€™s praise.â€ pic.twitter.com/FqwnMJF9El Former NBA star DeMarcus Cousinsâ€™ double-double debut saw the Taiwan Beer Leopards secure a 119-90 blowout win against the Tainan TSG GhostHawks on Saturday. The Leopards improved to 9-4 after the game, tying the New Taipei CTBC DEA atop the five-team T1 LEAGUE on the back of a franchise-record five-game winning streak. The 6,015 spectators who turned up for Cousinâ€™s debut also set a new attendance record for the Leopards at the Taoyuan Arena, the franchiseâ€™s home since last summer. Cousins logged 13 points, 10 rebounds, five assists, two steals, and one block in 28:24 on the floor â€” a performance the four-time NBA All-Star suggested he could exceed with adequate rest. â€œIâ€™m jet-lagged; I just got off a 14-hour flight. Iâ€™ll get some recovery after this game, get my legs fresh, and be ready for tomorrow. So hopefully, itâ€™s a better performance,â€ the 33-year-old center said after the game. Udonis Haslem spent 20 seasons wearing a Miami Heat jersey. Now, his jersey will forever hang from the rafters in the Heatâ€™s home arena. During a halftime ceremony in the middle of Friday nightâ€™s game between the Heat and Atlanta Hawks at Kaseya Center, Haslemâ€™s No. 40 jersey was retired by the organization. Haslem, 43, became the sixth Heat player to have his jersey retired, joining Alonzo Mourning, Tim Hardaway, Shaquille Oâ€™Neal, Chris Bosh and Dwyane Wade. â€œLook at the list of the guys Iâ€™m sitting with,â€ Haslem said, referring to the first five Heat players who had their jerseys retired and are already in the Basketball Hall of Fame. â€œThatâ€™s whatâ€™s huge to me.Thatâ€™s what makes me feel so amazing is the core group of guys that Iâ€™m sitting with. Pat Riley ainâ€™t just putting anybody up there. The Arisons ainâ€™t just OKâ€™ing anybody to go up in those rafters.â€ Haslem, who was born at Miamiâ€™s North Shore Medical Center and grew up in Liberty City before playing at Miami High, then dedicated a part of his speech to his hometown of Miami â€” the area code 305. â€œLiberty City, Overtown, Little Havana, Little Haiti, everybody, tonight when this jersey goes up in the rafters, all of yâ€™all coming with me,â€ Haslem said during the speech.â€œThe love yâ€™all show me in this city, I love you guys, I appreciate you guys. â€¦. 305, you got to hold it up. You got to hold up the 305. Tonight, we all celebrate, 305.â€ Even though Haslemâ€™s playing career is over and his Heat jersey is now retired, heâ€™ll remain around the organization.The Heat hired him as the vice president of basketball development in November and he still hopes to become part of the Heatâ€™s ownership group one day. â€œTo be able to get out, make it, excel and succeed, I hope itâ€™s a great example for other kids in Miami, in Liberty City and for my kids, as well,â€ Haslem said. â€œâ€¦ This is a dream come true.â€ January 20, 2024 | 10:28 am EST Update Wizards sign Trey Jemison Shams Charania: The Washington Wizards plan to sign center Trey Jemison to a 10-day contract out of the NBA G Leagueâ€™s Birmingham Squadronsources tell @TheAthletic @Stadium. Jemison has averaged 13.6 points and 12.3 rebounds in G League this season.
